article_title: BUZ LIVINGSTON: Planning for Medicare premium increases

article_metadata.description:
Kiplingers, the Wall Street Journal and PBS ran columns warning of massive 2016 Medicare Part B premium increases. While they publicize soaring premiums, in reality, seventy to eighty percent of Medicare beneficiaries will see no change from the standard $104.90 monthly rate.
Medicare Part B premiums are tied to modified adjusted gross income (MAGI) and deducted from Social Security payments. By law, when there is no Social Security cost of living adjustment, Medicare Part B premiums cannot
article_metadata.author: Buz Livingston
